article.title: Quantum diffusion during inflation and primordial black holes

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the probability distribution of the number of e-folds *N* for different values of *v* in a quadratic potential. What happens to the PDF as *v* increases?
choices: The PDF becomes more peaked and closer to a Gaussian distribution.
The PDF has a larger mean value and a larger spread, and deviates from a Gaussian distribution.
The PDF has a smaller mean value and a smaller spread, and becomes more asymmetric.
The PDF becomes a Dirac distribution centered around *N* = 0.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure compares the NLO (Gaussian) and NNLO approximations of the PDF of the number of e-folds *N* for different values of *v*. Which statement is true about these approximations?
choices: The approximations are always better at larger values of *v*.
The NNLO approximation always provides a worse fit than the NLO one.
The approximations are better at smaller values of *v*, and the NNLO approximation always provides a better fit than the NLO one.
The NLO and NNLO approximations coincide for all values of *v*.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the probability distributions of the number of e-folds *N* for different values of φ in a constant potential. What happens to the distribution as φ approaches φend?
choices: The distribution becomes more spread out and less peaked.
The distribution remains unchanged.
The distribution becomes more peaked and shifts to larger values of *N*.
The distribution becomes more peaked and shifts to smaller values of *N*.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure compares the full probability distribution with two approximations ((4.5) and (4.12)) for different values of φ in a constant potential. Which statement is true about these approximations?
choices: Both approximations are valid for all values of φ.
Approximation (4.5) is valid only for φ  φend, while approximation (4.12) is valid for all φ.
Both approximations are valid only for φ close to φend, but approximation (4.5) is slightly better than (4.12).
Approximation (4.12) is significantly better than approximation (4.5) for all φ.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the mass fraction β of primordial black holes in the quantum diffusion dominated regime as a function of different parameters. Which statement is true about the dependence of β on these parameters?
choices: β depends strongly on φ and weakly on µ.
β depends weakly on both φ and µ.
β depends strongly on µ and weakly on φ.
β depends strongly on both φ and µ.
